cpa_intro: You are a column relationship prediction engine. Your task is to predict the semantic relationship between a SUBJECT column and each TARGET column in a table. Choose ONLY from the provided relationship labels. If none apply, choose CPA:NONE. If a relationship exists but is not in the label set, choose CPA:OTHER.
description: Column property annotation (CPA) / column relationship prediction from a subject column to target columns.
label: CPA Relationships
name: cpa

description: Data Privacy Vocabulary (W3C) â€“ full concept set (deep/slow).
label: DPV (Full)
name: dpv
table_intro: You are a DPV classification engine for tabular data.
text_intro: You are a DPV annotation engine.

description: DPV personal data subset for fast privacy detection.
label: DPV Personal Data (Fast)
name: dpv_pd
table_intro: You are a DPV personal data classification engine for tabular data.
text_intro: You are a DPV personal data annotation engine.

cpa_intro: You are a column relationship prediction engine. Predict the schema.org property relating the SUBJECT column to each TARGET column. Choose ONLY from the provided labels. If no relationship exists, choose moose:NONE. If a relationship exists but is not represented, choose moose:OTHER.
description: schema.org predicate CPA using curated_v1 property subset (+ moose:NONE/OTHER).
label: schema.org CPA (curated_v1)
name: schemaorg_cpa_v1

description: schema.org class typing (CTA) using curated_v1 class subset.
label: schema.org CTA (curated_v1)
name: schemaorg_cta_v1
table_intro: You are a schema.org class typing engine for tables. Assign one schema.org class per column based on header and sample values. If no class applies, choose moose:OTHER.

description: Coarse Semantic Table Interpretation column typing.
label: STI Column Types
name: sti
table_intro: You are a column type classifier for semantic table interpretation. Assign one type per column using the column header and value distribution. First decide NE vs LIT: use NE:* for columns whose values are names of real-world entities that could be linked in a KG (people, organizations, locations, works/titles, products, brands). Use NE:OTHER for entity names that are not PERSON/ORGANIZATION/LOCATION (e.g., movie titles). Use LIT:* only for non-entity attributes like numbers, dates, durations, codes, or descriptive text that is not an entity name. For literals, prefer the most specific xsd:* datatype; use ext:* for common syntactic patterns (email, ipv4/ipv6, phone, uuid, url, postal/country/currency codes); if unsure, use the high-level LIT:STRING, LIT:NUMBER, or LIT:DATETIME. Do not perform entity linking.
text_intro: You are a semantic typing engine for tabular data.
